title: An interesting phenomenon with Xayah/Rakan
body:
I've noticed something odd happening when I'm playing Rakan alongside a Xayah:

There's less hostility between the ADC and I.

Normally while playing in bot lane, it's always a matter of time before someone gets pissed off, someone makes a stupid mistake, someone gets killed because they fucked up, etc.  But when playing these two, something about the characters' relationship seems to rub off on the players.  I'm way more forgiving when a Xayah fucks up, and my own mistakes seem to be forgiven as well.  Maybe it's just because I see Xayah as a character rather than another player, and it's harder to get mad at a character.  Or maybe the interactions just make playing alongside a Xayah more enjoyable.  Either way, it's doing something positive.

I know Riot is starting to roll out VO reworks, and I'm wondering if adding more robust interactions similar to these two would help foster better teamwork.  it certainly seems to be working here.
